20101230130907.000|20101230130909.000|TR0|aren't moving as fast, a lot of people on

20101230131707.000|20101230131709.000|TR0|
20101230131709.000|20101230131711.000|TR0|MARTIN SAVIDGE, CNN CORRESPONDENT:  The 
20101230131711.000|20101230131713.000|TR0|United States entered World War I in 1916. 
20101230131713.000|20101230131715.000|TR0| No.  It was 1917.
20101230131715.000|20101230131717.000|TR0|
20101230131717.000|20101230131719.000|TR0|There were 12 Confederate states.  
20101230131719.000|20101230131721.000|TR0|Actually, there were 11.
20101230131721.000|20101230131723.000|TR0|
20101230131723.000|20101230131725.000|TR0|In 1800, New Orleans was a U.S. port.  No. 
20101230131725.000|20101230131727.000|TR0| It was still under Spanish control.
20101230131727.000|20101230131729.000|TR0|
20101230131729.000|20101230131731.000|TR0|These and dozens of other errors can be 
20101230131731.000|20101230131733.000|TR0|found in the textbook handed out to 
20101230131733.000|20101230131735.000|TR0|thousands of Virginia fourth graders.  
20101230131735.000|20101230131737.000|TR0|Problems with the book "Our Virginia Past  
20101230131737.000|20101230131739.000|TR0|&  Present" published by Five Ponds Press 
20101230131739.000|20101230131741.000|TR0|first surfaced last October as reported by 
20101230131741.000|20101230131743.000|TR0|the "Washington Post" when the mother of a 
20101230131743.000|20101230131745.000|TR0|fourth grader, a college history 
20101230131745.000|20101230131747.000|TR0|professor, spotted several lines on page 
20101230131747.000|20101230131749.000|TR0|122.
20101230131749.000|20101230131751.000|TR0|
20101230131751.000|20101230131753.000|TR0|PROF. CAROL SHERIFF, PARENT OF A VIRGINIA 
20101230131753.000|20101230131755.000|TR0|FOURTH GRADER:  It was particularly 
20101230131755.000|20101230131757.000|TR0|jarring when I got to this one passage 
20101230131757.000|20101230131759.000|TR0|that was so at odds with what historians 
20101230131759.000|20101230131801.000|TR0|have been saying about who participated in 
20101230131801.000|20101230131803.000|TR0|the civil war.      SAVIDGE:  The book 
20101230131803.000|20101230131805.000|TR0|says thousands of blacks fought in the 
20101230131805.000|20101230131807.000|TR0|confederate ranks, something not supported 
20101230131807.000|20101230131809.000|TR0|by mainstream Civil War scholarship, but 
20101230131809.000|20101230131811.000|TR0|it's the next line that's just plain 
20101230131811.000|20101230131813.000|TR0|wrong.  Quote, "Including two black 
20101230131813.000|20101230131815.000|TR0|battalions under the command of stonewall 
20101230131815.000|20101230131817.000|TR0|Jackson," unquote.
20101230131817.000|20101230131819.000|TR0|
20101230131819.000|20101230131821.000|TR0|SHERIFF:  The textbook actually does note 
20101230131821.000|20101230131823.000|TR0|that it wasn't until 1865 that 
20101230131823.000|20101230131825.000|TR0|African-Americans could legally serve in 
20101230131825.000|20101230131827.000|TR0|the confederate army.  It also tells 
20101230131827.000|20101230131829.000|TR0|children that Stonewall Jackson died in 
20101230131829.000|20101230131831.000|TR0|1863.
20101230131831.000|20101230131833.000|TR0|
20101230131833.000|20101230131835.000|TR0|SAVIDGE:  The error about black serving in 
20101230131835.000|20101230131837.000|TR0|the confederate army was outrageous to 
20101230131837.000|20101230131839.000|TR0|many in academia.
20101230131839.000|20101230131841.000|TR0|
20101230131841.000|20101230131843.000|TR0|JEREMY MAYER, GEORGE MASON UNIVERSITY:  It 
20101230131843.000|20101230131845.000|TR0|is the equivalent of holocaust denial 
20101230131845.000|20101230131847.000|TR0|being thought in the public schools, but 
20101230131847.000|20101230131849.000|TR0|worse, it's also the equivalent of saying 
20101230131849.000|20101230131851.000|TR0|that the Jews helped the holocaust.
20101230131851.000|20101230131853.000|TR0|
20101230131853.000|20101230131855.000|TR0|SAVIDGE:  The textbook author who is not a 
20101230131855.000|20101230131857.000|TR0|historian said she found the information 
20101230131857.000|20101230131859.000|TR0|while researching online.  The publisher

20101230135419.000|20101230135421.000|TR0|closely followed by a second one before 
20101230135421.000|20101230135423.000|TR0|the brain has time to heal.

20101230135427.000|20101230135429.000|TR0|uncontrollably.
20101230135429.000|20101230135431.000|TR0|
20101230135431.000|20101230135433.000|TR0|(on camera):  Now during a concussion, the 
20101230135433.000|20101230135435.000|TR0|brain which is the consistency of Jell-O 
20101230135435.000|20101230135437.000|TR0|is stretched and twisted and all sorts of 
20101230135437.000|20101230135439.000|TR0|things are happening.  As the brain is 
20101230135439.000|20101230135441.000|TR0|rocked, chemicals start to flood it 
20101230135441.000|20101230135443.000|TR0|damaging all sorts of different cells 
20101230135443.000|20101230135445.000|TR0|within the brain and throwing the brain 
20101230135445.000|20101230135447.000|TR0|into a sort of state of crisis.
20101230135447.000|20101230135449.000|TR0|
20101230135449.000|20101230135451.000|TR0|Now, with rest, those damaged cells can 
20101230135451.000|20101230135453.000|TR0|heal.  But when a second concussion 
20101230135453.000|20101230135455.000|TR0|happens too soon after the first, brain 
20101230135455.000|20101230135457.000|TR0|cells die and that's when permanent damage 
20101230135457.000|20101230135459.000|TR0|sets in.
